string-array.name: PercentAcryArray
string-array.item: @string/PercentAcry_30
@string/PercentAcry_40

string-array.name: before_protocol_array
string-array.item: 1) Clean all glass plates, spacers and work surfaces with ethanol.
2) Assemble the plates and spacers into the stand provided by the manufacturer.
3) In a clean flask, pipette desired quantity of ddH2O as determined by the gel calculator
4) Add the Acrylamide, 1.5 M Tris pH 8.8 and 10% SDS
5) When ready to use, add TEMED and APS- pour immediately (the gel will begin to polymerize after the addition of APS)
6) Pour the solution into the assembled glass plates to the desired height (typically to just below the level of the lane-comb, about 4/5 the way up the plates)
7) Overlay the solution with 1-2 ml of n-butanol to ensure a smooth gel surface, aiding straight and uniform protein band separation.
8) The gel will take 30-45 mins to polymerize, any left over solution can be inspected to ensure full polymerization before proceeding
9) Gels can be stored for up to two weeks at 4Â°C, but must be wrapped in wet paper towels to avoid drying
10) Clean the lane- comb with ethanol
11) Pour off n-butanol from the gel and dab dry the area above the gel with filter paper
12) In a clean flask, pipette desired quantity of ddH2O as determined by the gel calculator
13) Add the Acrylamide, 0.5 M Tris pH 6.8 and 10% SDS
14) When ready to use, add TEMED and APS
15) Pour stacking gel on top of separating gel and add in lane-comb
16) The gel will take 20-30 mins to polymerize, any left over solution can be inspected to ensure full polymerization before proceeding

string-array.name: About_array
string-array.item: 1) Enter the number of gels that you want to generate
2) Enter the percentage for the gel
3) This application has been build by www.jumpercake.com
4) The formulae for generating the gels have been provided by Dr Nicholas Tobin, biologist in the Cancer Centre Karolinska, Stockhom
